Submodules¶

local.DatabaseSetup module¶

Setup task for database management

class local.DatabaseSetup.DatabaseSetup¶

Class to manage database setup tasks

Tasks: Connections, execution of sql script, deleting old and setup new database from script

static delete_existing_database(database_connection, env_setting)¶

Drop all existing database as per the names

Parameters:
  • database_connection (pyodbc.Connection) – connection object to database
  • env_setting (dict) – environment configuration
static execute_sql_script(database_connection, sql_path)¶

Execute SQL script

Parameters:
  • database_connection (pyodbc.Connection) – connection object to database
  • sql_path (str) – path to SQL script
static get_database_connection(server, username, password)¶

Establish database connection and return the Database handler

Parameters:
  • server (str) – database server
  • username (str) – database username
  • password (str) – database password
Returns:

database object
Return type:

Database
static recreate_database_from_script(database_connection, sql_path, env_setting)¶

Drop existing and recreate new database

Parameters:
  • database_connection (pyodbc.Connection) – connection object to database
  • sql_path (str) – path to SQL script
  • env_setting (dict) – environment configuration
static setup_sql_script(sql_path, env_setting)¶

Change values in a valid SQL script and to make it ready for database setup

Parameters:
  • sql_path (str) – path to SQL script
  • env_setting (dict) – environment configuration

local.ManageAdditonalTask module¶

Task such as setting up database and cleanup

class local.ManageAdditonalTask.ManageAdditionalTask(application_details, environment_setting, database_connection)¶
This class will manage additional tasks of setup such as:
  • Get the right SQL script to use for creation of database
  • Create database backup, as this is required in RAM clear scenarios
  • Cleanup directories as specified in config file. E.g. Logs and database backups
Parameters:
  • application_details (dict) – application details
  • environment_setting (dict) – environment details
  • database_connection (DatabaseSetup) – Database connection
application_details = {}¶
close_running_process()¶

Close running windows processes in the list process_to_terminate

database_connection = None¶
database_task()¶

After creating new database, create backup database :return: status :rtype: bool

delete_directory_contents()¶

Delete contents of folder/dir as per list in config file “cleanup_directories”

environment_setting = {}¶

local.ManageApplicationDownload module¶

Task related to application download

class local.ManageApplicationDownload.ManageApplicationDownload(app_setting, env_setting)¶

This class will handled creation of download object handlers as per the application/artifacts listed in the configuration.

Any new artifact to download, just add it to the config file.

application_details = {}¶
application_name_keys = []¶
config_folder_path = None¶

Start the downlaod process of the artifact(s)

download_application_root_path = None¶
exclude_file_extension = []¶

Returns:application_details
Return type:dict
process_to_terminate = []¶

local.ManageApplicationReplace module¶

Task to manage application replace

class local.ManageApplicationReplace.ManageApplicationReplace(application_details, env_setting)¶

This class will handled replacement of artifacts. Delete old artifact and copy the new downloaded artifact(s)

local.ManagePostDownload module¶

Task to post download activity

class local.ManagePostDownload.ManagePostDownload(environment_setting, application_details)¶
This class will handled task after artifacts have been downloaded.
  • Extract all xml configuration files of controller
  • modify xml files as per need and specification in json configuration
application_details = {}¶
config_update_setting = {}¶
extract_config_file()¶

Extract controller (xml) files

modify_xml_config()¶

Modify attribute/property in xml file. These values will come from json config

start_post_download_task()¶

Execute extraction of controller config files and update them if required

local.database module¶

Manage database task

class local.database.Database(server, username, password)¶

Class to manage database connection and task Tasks: Connections, execution of sql script, query and getting results

Parameters:
  • connection (pyodbc.Connection) – database connection
  • cursor (pyodbc.Cursor) – database cursor for operation
  • sql_script_execute_string (str) – SQL query string
connect_to_db(db_server, db_username, db_password)¶

Connect to SQL Server

Parameters:
  • db_server (str) – database service/instance name
  • db_username (str) – database user name for authentication
  • db_password (str) – database password for authentication
Returns:

connection, cursor
Return type:

pyodbc.Connection, pyodbc.Cursor
db_exists(database_name)¶

Check if database is present

Parameters:database_name (str) – name of database
Returns:True/False
Return type:bool
delete_backup_history(database_name)¶

Delete Database Backup and Restore history from MSDB System Database

Parameters:database_name (str) – name of database
Returns:SQL result
Return type:str
delete_db(database_name)¶

Delete database with the database name

Parameters:database_name (str) – name of database
Returns:True/False
Return type:bool

Parameters:database_name (str) – name of database

Parameters:sql_script_path (str) – path to SQL script

Send SQL Query to database for execution and return result

Parameters:sql_query (str) – SQL query
Returns:self.cursor.fetchall()
Return type:list

Parameters:database_name (str) – name of database
